intro: Psychotria mandiocana, commonly known as the Brazilian Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often found in the understory of tropical forests. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are toxic to humans but serve as a food source for certain wildlife. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
